e3c0f476-4223-465d-855d-129d410abbee.description: Earners of the CME Outfitters Addressing Unconscious Bias and Disparities in Healthcare program have developed the skills needed to effectively recognize and address unconscious bias and racial disparities in their own practices. They are competent in skills such as understanding stigma and barriers to care, actions to improve their practices as well as positively impact patient care.
e3c0f476-4223-465d-855d-129d410abbee.name: Addressing Unconscious Bias & Disparities in Healthcare

alignments.name: CME/CE Credits
alignments.description: Each qualifying activity provides certain credit types and credit hours. See each activity's details page for the credit type and amount at https://www.cmeoutfitters.com/about-us/

badge_template_activities.title: Earner must complete 3 or more activities as part of Addressing Unconscious Bias and Disparities in Healthcare: A Call to Action.
Post-tests, credit request forms, and activity evaluations must be completed for a minimum of 3 activities. 75% pass rate required.

skills.name: Apply Concepts Of Inclusion Into Healthcare And Patient Care Settings
Apply Interventions To Increase Treatment Adherence
Apply Strategies To Engage Minorities In Their Care
Understand The Role Of Unconscious Bias And Racial Disparity In Health Care

5c48a6f7-20a4-430f-bfcf-6b228abb805c.description: Earners have developed the skills needed to integrate screening assessments for the early and accurate diagnosis of mild-to-moderate COVID-19 to guide treatment decision-making in high-risk patient groups. They are competent in skills such as applying the latest data on the efficacy and safety of monoclonal antibody therapies to treatment decisions and implementing strategies to address knowledge and practice barriers to patient access to infusion service for monoclonal antibody therapy.
5c48a6f7-20a4-430f-bfcf-6b228abb805c.name: COVID-19 Monoclonal Antibody Treatment Training

badge_template_activities.title: Earners must complete the activity, "Bench to Bedside: The Growing (Anti)body of Evidence for the Treatment of Mild-to-Moderate COVID-19."
Post-test, credit request form, and activity evaluation must be completed. 75% pass rate required.

skills.name: Risk Factors For COVID Disease Severity

8b5eea88-25b8-41e0-9f1e-e7ca672704f9.description: Earners demonstrate an understanding of disease risk, HIV status, treatment initiation and adherence. They are able to effectively communicate with health care professionals about comorbidities, especially as part of aging, and understand testing and initiation of PrEP. Earners have gained knowledge of what to expect from HIV treatment, including RAPID Start. They understand the importance of bone health, the effects of age on HIV and how ART can support living long, healthy lives.
8b5eea88-25b8-41e0-9f1e-e7ca672704f9.name: Community HIV Health Training

badge_template_activities.title: Earners must complete 3 of these designated educational activities:  1) What is RAPID Start?  2) Talking to your healthcare professional about your treatment preferences 3) Testing and Treatment 4) Video:  Bone Health Is Important to Everyone! 5) Video: A Long Life Ahead: Thinking About Age and HIV

f6385d9a-d93e-4931-beff-e45e3f0db2d2.description: Earners demonstrate knowledge of how mycophenolate works in the body, the potential for first trimester pregnancy loss, and the types of congenital malformations that can occur if mycophenolate REMS is not followed. They can counsel patients about risks of pregnancy while taking mycophenolate and give recommendations on contraceptive measures and potential immunosuppressant alternatives. Earners can implement monitoring strategies and report pregnancies to the Mycophenolate Pregnancy Registry.
f6385d9a-d93e-4931-beff-e45e3f0db2d2.name: Navigating the Mycophenolate REMS

badge_template_activities.title: Earners must complete 3 of these designated educational activities: 1) Mycophenolate: Clinical Uses, Serious Risks; 2) Communication is Key: Ensuring Pregnancy Prevention/Safe Planning in Patients of Reproductive Potential; 3) The Mycophenolate Pregnancy Registry. Post-test, credit request form, and activity evaluation must be completed. 75% pass rate required.
